title: Bake Off 2019: Ruby, Selasi and Antony reunite to cheer on finalists
text:
Former Bake Off stars Ruby Bhogal, Selasi Gbormittah and Antony Amourdoux reunite (Picture: Instagram / @becalynepirkis)

The Great British Bake Off finale has been supported by past contestants who have settled down with a whole load of popcorn ahead of the show.

Taking to Instagram, the official account for the show shared an adorable clip of the team looking cosy in front of the TV.

And while they celebrated this year’s season, Selasi Gbormittah introduced a countdown to the show, while surrounded by the likes of last season’s Ruby Bhogal and Antony Amourdoux.

Holding his snacks up to the camera, he beamed: ‘Okay, guys, so the 15-minute countdown starts now, and we are here eating popcorn ready to watch the final of The Great British Bake Off.’

As his baking buddies started to cheer around him, the star continued: ‘So make sure you tune in!’

After a stressful and hilarious season, Steph Blackwell, Alice Fevronia and David Atherton are the three contestants to have made it to the final.

They were cheering on the finalists (Picture: @britishbakeoff)

This your official 15 minute warning: put the kettle on, grab your snacks. The Final starts at 8pm on Channel 4. #GBBOFinal pic.twitter.com/tcrGIMrXKb — British Bake Off (@BritishBakeOff) October 29, 2019

And as it stands, Steph is the 4/5 odds-on favourite to take the crown.

The pint-sized baker has been consistent throughout the show, winning Star Baker an impressive four times.

A Ladbrokes spokesperson said: ‘Steph has consistently been the best baker in the tent, even on her weaker bakes, and it’d be a huge surprise if she didn’t land the prize.’

Alice, who has won Star Baker twice this year, follows at 3/1, while David, who hasn’t won Star Baker once, is the least safe bet at 4/1.

They shared an adorable video ahead of the show (Picture: Channel 4)

When he found out he was going to be on the show, his emotions were mixed.

He said: ‘When I got accepted it was such a mixture of emotions. Then I thought, this is really crazy, am I good enough, will I have enough time to practice?’

The final round of the contest will see the trio make the ‘ultimate chocolate cake’ for their Signature Bake.

They will then test their skills with the Technical Challenge, which will focus on the tricky souffle.

And finally, they’ll pull out all the stops for their Showstopper – an edible illusion picnic which is all about crafting a ‘deliciously deceptive feast’.

The Bake Off final airs tonight from 8pm on Channel 4.
